H0.text: What was the first airship to cross the Atlantic, in 1919. Zeppelin LZ-120

H1.text: What was the first airship to cross the Atlantic, in 1919. Akron

H2.text: What was the first airship to cross the Atlantic, in 1919. Graf Zeppelin

H3.text: What was the first airship to cross the Atlantic, in 1919. R34

A4.text: Major George Herbert Scott of the Royal Air Force flew the airship R34 with his crew and passengers from RAF East Fortune, Scotland to Mineola, New York (on Long Island) in about four and a half days.

A5.text: The flight was intended as a testing ground for postwar commercial services by airship (see Imperial Airship Scheme), and it was the first flight to transport paying passengers.
